div.l: Wil hath this miller͗e verneyst his hed
Ful pale he was for dronken and not red
He yoxeht and spekith þoruȝ þe nose
As he were on þe quakke or the pose
To bed he goth and with him goth his wyff
As ony Iaye sheheshe liȝt was and Iolyf
So was hir Ioly whistill well y wet
The cradell att hir beddes fete is sett
To rokken and to yeue the Child sowke
And whanne dronke was þe alealþe ale in þe Crowke
To bedde wente þe douȝtir ryȝt anon̄
To bedde goth aleyn and eke Iohn
There is no more him nedith no dwale
This miller͗e hath so bibed ale
That as an hors he froutith in his slep
Ne of his tayle behynde he tok no kep
His wif bare him a burdon̄ ful stronge
Men myȝte hire routhyng her a forlonge
The wenche routhiþ eke ꝑper compaignie
And þe clerc þat herde this melodye
He rokked Iohn and seyde slepest thow
Herest thow euyr swilk song er now
Loo swilke a compen ys betwyx hem alle
A wilde fire on hir bodies falle
How harkened euer swilk a ferly thyng
Ye they shull haue the flour͗e of yuell endyng
This lange nyȝt there tides me no reste
But ȝit no force all shal be for þe beste
For Iohn seyde he as euer mote y thriue
Yef that y may ȝone wenche woll y swyue
Som esement hath lawe shapen vs
For Iohn there ys a lawe that saith thus
That yef aman be in o poynt agreued
That In anothur he shall be releued
Oure corn̄ is stolen sothely it is no nay
And we haue had an euel fitt to day
And sith y shall haue non̄ amendement
A geyn my losse y will haue myn esement
